extendedIngredients.name: bell peppers
extendedIngredients.originalString: 6 medium-sized bell peppers (your choice of color)

extendedIngredients.name: canned black beans
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 can (15oz) black beans, drained and rinsed

extendedIngredients.name: cooked quinoa
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 & 1/2 cups cooked quinoa (cook according to package instructions)

extendedIngredients.name: shredded cheddar cheese
extendedIngredients.originalString: Shredded cheddar cheese, optional for topping

recipes.title: Vegetarian Quinoa Mexican Stuffed Peppers

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Noir, Riesling, and Sparkling rosé are great choices for Mexican. Acidic white wines like riesling or low-tannin reds like pinot noir can work well with Mexican dishes. Sparkling rosé is a safe pairing too. The MacMurray Ranch Russian River Pinot Noir with a 4 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 24 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: MacMurray Ranch Russian River Pinot Noir
productMatches.description: Our MacMurray Ranch 2012 Russian River Valley Pinot Noir opens with aromas of lavender and boysenberry that give way to flavors of dark cherry and pomegranate. This luscious wine has a silky mouthfeel, framed by subtle hints of oak from barrel aging.

recipes.instructions: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.Start by preparing the peppers. Slice the top off each pepper about 1? from the stem end, then remove any seeds or ribs left inside. If any of the peppers are a little crooked, slice a little off the bottom until they stand up straight. Arrange the peppers cut side up in a baking dish, and set aside.Next, make the filling. In a large skillet set over medium-high heat, heat the canola oil. Add the onion and garlic and sauté for 5-7 minutes or until soft. Stir in the quinoa, beans, corn, tomato puree, chili powder and cumin, and continue cooking for 5 minutes or until everything is heated through.Remove from heat and stir in the cilantro.Spoon the quinoa mixture into the peppers, making sure not to pack too tightly.Bake for 25-30 minutes or until peppers are tender. If you'd like to add cheese: sprinkle the tops with cheese and bake for 5 more minutes.Serve right away.

steps.step: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.Start by preparing the peppers. Slice the top off each pepper about 1? from the stem end, then remove any seeds or ribs left inside. If any of the peppers are a little crooked, slice a little off the bottom until they stand up straight. Arrange the peppers cut side up in a baking dish, and set aside.Next, make the filling. In a large skillet set over medium-high heat, heat the canola oil.

Add the onion and garlic and sauté for 5-7 minutes or until soft. Stir in the quinoa, beans, corn, tomato puree, chili powder and cumin, and continue cooking for 5 minutes or until everything is heated through.
Remove from heat and stir in the cilantro.Spoon the quinoa mixture into the peppers, making sure not to pack too tightly.
Bake for 25-30 minutes or until peppers are tender. If you'd like to add cheese: sprinkle the tops with cheese and bake for 5 more minutes.
